newsitem.title: USA: MGE spring wheat firm in nearby March on weather.
newsitem.headline: MGE spring wheat firm in nearby March on weather.

text.p: Harsh weather in the Dakotas which was slowing an already-mild pace of farmer selling boosted nearby March MGE wheat futures relative to other months, traders said.
"Continental and Peavey are buying the front end, each of them bought 300,000 to 500,000 (bushels of March)," a trader said.
The traders said mills were having difficulty originating wheat due to the blizzard-like weather in the upper Midwest.
"Because of the weather in North Dakota, farmers haven't moved much wheat," the trader said.
The March/May traded at 22 cents per bushel, premium the March, they said.
Gains were limited by a sag in other wheat markets with diminished fears of winterkill in the U.S. winter wheat growing region weighing on the Chicago and Kansas City wheat markets.
At 0952 CST, MGE spring wheat futures were one cent per bushel higher to 1/2 lower, with March up one at $3.93-1/2.
